intro: Galium fragile, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny white to pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium fragile is often found in temperate regions and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance in supporting insect life.
